summary.purpose: Provides a styled Label component built on top of @radix-ui/react-label, following the shadcn/ui design pattern for accessible form labels.
summary.problem_solved: Wraps Radix UI's Label primitive with consistent Tailwind CSS styling including text size, font weight, text selection prevention, and automatic disabled state handling when used with peer/group patterns.

details.what_it_does: Renders a Radix UI Label primitive with pre-configured Tailwind CSS styles. Sets data-slot='label' attribute for CSS targeting. Applies text styling (text-sm, medium font weight, foreground color, line-height). Automatically handles disabled states via group-data and peer-disabled CSS patterns: when associated form element is disabled, the label becomes semi-transparent and non-interactive. Text is non-selectable by default.
details.rendered_ui_description: A small (text-sm), medium-weight label text in foreground color with leading line-height of 4. Non-selectable text. When a grouped or peer-disabled form element is disabled, the label opacity reduces to 50% and pointer events are disabled.

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using Label without proper htmlFor attribute
incorrect.why_incorrect: The Label component should always have the htmlFor prop matching the associated input's id. This creates a semantic connection for accessibility, allowing screen readers to announce the label when the input is focused, and making the label clickable to focus the input.
